reviews.sentence: Its rare to find hotels that have 2 bedroom suites ideal for us on a girls weekend away. The location was great and the facilities were fine for what we paid for and what the hotel was rated as. The staff could have been a bit warmer in their interactions with guests. I found them ok but sometimes really lacking in attentiveness ie waiting at the desk for assistance with none else around but staff not looking up to see you.

Fantastic stay. The hotel was in a great location. Close to everything. It was near the train station Etihad stadium and close to shopping. about 8 10 minutes walk. The hotel rooms were fantastic and spaces and very clean. Felt very comfortable. A blond lady was so very nice and welcoming and lovely and so helpful. The ONLY complaint I would make is two staff receptionist were very rude in the way they spoke to us. We asked them about what they would recommend to us about things to visit in Melbourne as we were not from Melbourne and they looked and responded to us in a quiet rude manner. Maybe they were having a bad day I am not sure. But that is the only complaint I have. Which is only a minor one. I have stayed at ALOT of hotels and all were happy to suggest places to visit. Except for these two ladies. Other then that our stay was beautiful and I would definitely come back to this hotel when I come back to Melbourne.

impolite receptionist not good room. location cleanliness location. Not good. Need to pay 40 for public far parkingdeal was with parking locating in special romno bath tub low basin tub no hot water bad room service no parking very impolite receptionist.

convient spot but would nt stay there again. staff did not explain how things worked had to ring a couple of days later and staff were abrupt and not helpful asked for single beds were not made almost inconvenience when I went and asked.

Un happy customer. The swimming pool. We had first checked into the hotel room and had asked for a cot to be provided upon searching the room we found there were no spare blankets sheets or pillows. There were two towels in the room which were not enough for a swim and a shower upon returning to our room. Later that night we had ordered room service. Upon searching for cutlery there was only one fork and one knife provided. we were asked by the room service team to leave our plates outside our door. We were up at 7 am the next morning for a swim and the dishes were yet to be collected I left the room again at 11 am to see that the room service plates had still not been collected which was absolutely disgusting to look at I felt as though the other occupants thought it was disgusting and that we were being judged by them. I was extremely hesitant to call the front desk as I had call a few times prior and was made to feel as if I was a nuisance. The high chairs are also extremely out dated and in appealing condition. I would be extremely hesitant to stay with oaks on market again.

Overall fine only 2 minor complaints 1. The universal remote would not change channels on the TV would do power and volume only. 2. This is one of these hotels that still consider Wifi a luxury rather that a basic service and price the wifi at exorbitant prices accordingly. For the room price the hotel should get the basics right in technology services.

Overall good but the smell was very discomforting. Great location. There was a terrible smell odour when the cleaners were cleaning the rooms and in the hall ways. Luckily that smell did not remain in the rooms but was very discomforting to smell ever time you would walk through the hallways whilst the staff were cleaning.

Not worth the money. Very insecure room charging system. I liked location of the hotel. It was walking distance of city attractions shopping malls Yara river etc. The view from the room was stunning. Breakfast was also very good. The staff. When I was checking in the girl that was working that day embarrassed me telling me that my credit card is not credit card and that they can not accept it because it is refused. She tried several times to use my credit card but she was confused and it seemed that she did not know how to use the POS machine. She was persistence telling me that my card is refused and that I should give the hotel my family members card number so that they can charge for their card my family was 18 0 km away. While she was doing that to me the line of the waiting guests was behind me. In the end I told her that I want to speak with the manager because my credit card was CREDIT card I showed her my booking confirmation I booked the hotel with the very same card. Finally she tried to write my card numbers manually and it finally worked. She did not even apologize. Very rude and very unprofesionalAlso when I was checking out I was in hurry taxi was waiting from me outside and I was waiting 15 minutes for someone to serve me on the reception. They told me there were some extra charges on my room number and that I had a drink in a bar on the second day of my stay. They wanted to charge me 30. The truth is that I was never in the hotel bar and I was never ordering anything from the bar in my room. I think the reason for that is very insecure system in the hotel where is enough to say your room number for everything but they do not actually require you showing them proof of your room number. I guess someone had a drinks in hotel bar and told my room number for charging. I still do not know if hotel is going to charge me for that but if they do I am going to sue them and request for security camera video tape of the day when I was apparently in the bar having drinks. The elevators are very slow and do not like the fact that hotel room cleaners are using guests lift. It takes forever to get down or up.

Not just with Oaks on Market but would be great to find accommodation in Melbourne who accept early checkin. When arriving into Melbourne at 0530 and having to wait until 2 pm for your room is a long time and most are not accommodating. Even with the offer to pay extra for an early checkin did not seem to align with the house rules. Still looking for that elusive property but thoroughly enjoyed Oaks on Market. I particularly loved dealing with Leigh and David both were extremely pleasant and very welcoming. Location is perfect close to tram stops easy access to the mall Federation Square. Very accessible.

Average. disappointed as stayed here lots of times before. No hot water on a saturday afternoon and into the night. shower head spraying water on roof and dripping down. Only 4 sugar satchels in tray for Coffee and Teas. Both days after room serviced and no biscuits to have with cupas.
Great central location. Staff were extremly friendly and acomodating. The down stairs bar is a great spot for a relaxing drink.

Excellent room. Close to transport. Comfortable. This staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel restaurant and bar are very nice and the room is serviced daily. The gym is well equipped and there is a pool spa and sauna for patrons use. I would definitely stay again. Nice room which was very clean with comfortable bedding. The hotel is in the city but the rooms are quiet. Close to public transport. Easy to get to Docklands South Bank Migration Museum and many more attractions.

Birthday weekend. Friendly staff Leigh was very friendly on greeting us. Great view from the 20th floor of the city and river. Just one thing on the downside the bathroom needs more bench space for a couple could not fit everything on the bench. Bed felt like you sank in it after a while but slept well overall.

Great location not the best apartment or service. Great location shame about the service and quality of cleanliness. Our initial apartment was not made up and had to change lucky they had a better room to offer us. Best to do a check before settling in.
Central location. Clean and well equipped friendly staff.

Great service. Fantastic attentive staff who even wheeled my daughters pram into the room upon arrival. We were lucky to be able to check in early so my little one could have a nap before heading out for the afternoon. Zero complaints here always clean great service with comfy beds.

Excellent location halfway between Flinders Street and Southern Cross train stations. A very warm welcome from the young man at reception Ruben. Room was large and the sauna was nice. Very reasonable price. Only complaint was that were two obnoxious young male guests in the pool area who were yelling and doing cannonball splash diving for over 30 minutes near to closing time preventing anyone else from using the pool so it would have been preferable to have a roaming warden patrolling the pool and gym area to keep people in line.

The best accommodation for the price anywhere in Melbourne. Our weekend in the city was highlighted by the beautiful views from the window of our perfectly clean and tidy room at Oaks on Market. All the staff we delt with were polite and knowledgeable. The gym pool spa and sauna are amazing. You couldnot go wrong by booking your next visit to the city at Oaks on Market. All the popular cbd attractions are just walking distance from the motel. Crown casino was just a stones throw from our window. We had a perfect weekend away. Thanks.

Staff were very obliging both at reception and cafe bar areas. Location was excellent for our requirements. We found the first night to be fairly noisy due to our room being located near the next door roof top bar and also the street noise.
